name: Inflow Direct Interaction — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if direct inflow (Hop 1) from Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes. Direct interaction with sanctioned entities is Critical-level per OFAC and UAE EOCN guidance.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & VARA Rulebook Section 3.1 & OFAC SDN Direct Contact = Critical

name: Inflow Near-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 2-3)
description: Freeze if near-distance inflow (Hop 2-3) from Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. VARA mandates zero tolerance for sanctioned fund sources within traceable distance.

name: Inflow Far-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 4-5)
description: Trigger EDD if far-distance inflow (Hop 4-5) from Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. Pollution decay reduces severity but sanctions exposure still requires enhanced investigation.

name: Inflow Exposure — Obfuscation (Zero-Tolerance)
description: Reject deposits with any exposure (>0%) to Obfuscation (Mixers, Privacy Tokens). VARA explicitly prohibits anonymity-enhanced crypto assets.

name: Inflow Exposure — Cybercrime/Gambling/High-Risk (Threshold)
description: Trigger EDD if inflow exposure to Cybercrime, Gambling, or High-Risk Entities exceeds 10% AND risk amount > 100 USD.

name: Outflow History — Target Directly Funded Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if the target address has directly sent funds (Hop 1 outflow) to Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. Direct outflow to sanctioned entities indicates intentional interaction.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & OFAC Prohibition on Providing Indirect Benefits

name: Outflow History — Target Indirectly Funded Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 2-3)
description: Trigger EDD if the target address has indirectly funded (Hop 2-3 outflow) Sanctions or Terrorism entities through intermediaries.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & OFAC Indirect Benefits Prohibition

name: Target Self-Tag — Sanctions/Freeze/Illicit
description: Freeze if the target address itself is tagged as Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes. Applies to both onboarding and deposit.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & VARA Rulebook Section 3.1 (CDD) & FATF Recommendation 10

name: Target Self-Tag — Cybercrime/Obfuscation
description: Trigger EDD if the target address itself is tagged as Cybercrime or Obfuscation. Addresses may acquire new risk labels after onboarding due to evolving threat intelligence.

name: CEX & TradFi Whitelist
description: Stop penetrating graph paths if a compliant Centralized Exchange or TradFi institution is encountered.

name: Outflow Direct Interaction — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if direct outflow (Hop 1) reaches Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen destination.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & VARA Rulebook Section 4 (STR)

name: Outflow Near-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 2-3)
description: Freeze if near-distance outflow (Hop 2-3) reaches Sanctions or Terrorism destination.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & VARA Rulebook Section 4 (Outflow Hop 2-3)

name: Outflow Far-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 4-5)
description: Trigger EDD if far-distance outflow (Hop 4-5) reaches Sanctions or Terrorism destination. Pollution decay applies but sanctions obligations require enhanced investigation.

name: Outflow Exposure — Cybercrime/Obfuscation/Gambling Destination (Threshold)
description: Trigger EDD if outflow reaches Cybercrime, Obfuscation, Gambling, or High-Risk destination with exposure > 10% AND amount > 100 USD.

name: Withdrawal Gate — Target Self-Tagged (Sanctions/Freeze/Illicit)
description: Freeze withdrawal if the target address itself is tagged as Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes.
reference: UAE Federal AML Law & VARA Rulebook Section 4 (Ongoing CDD)

name: Withdrawal Gate — Target Self-Tagged (Cybercrime/Obfuscation)
description: Trigger EDD on withdrawal if the target address itself is tagged as Cybercrime or Obfuscation.

name: VARA Travel Rule & CDD Trigger
description: Trigger Travel Rule and mandatory CDD for transactions > 950 USD (approx AED 3500).

name: Single Transaction KYC Trigger (>950 USD)
description: Trigger full KYC/CDD verification if a single transaction exceeds 950 USD (~AED 3500) per UAE threshold.
reference: UAE Federal AML Threshold (AED 3,500) & VARA CDD Requirements

name: VARA Structuring Alert
description: Trigger review if daily cumulative volume > 950 USD to detect smurfing.
